storyInfo: The statue burns in the square, and invitations to dance—both past and present—overlap as Eblana and Loughshinny face each other, separated by the departed hero in between. In the end, Loughshinny receives an agreement, and takes the deceased out of Na Saoirsí and towards the historical ruins.

attributes.text: Once there was a red dragon of pride, who snubbed all companions, talking only to herself in the mirror from time to time.
Once, at Samhain, she was to host a grand banquet and her mirrored self was to help. But the two could not appear together before the guests, or the reflection would perish.
The reflection had no choice but to obey the dragon's will. She went and fetched the wakeman for the banquet. The wakeman rejected their invitation and told the reflection to desert.
Still, the reflection returned to the lair on her own, only to find the banquet had already begun. The reflection hurried to hide in darkness beyond the bonfire.
As the banquet went on, the guests somehow began to vanish, one by one. And the red dragon found and dragged her mirrored self out of the darkness, forcing the reflection to dance with her.
The two kept dancing, so relentlessly that the reflection could not feel her toes. She asked for a little rest, but the red dragon was never satisfied.

attributes.content: Here, Loughshinny.
The book you wanted. The sequel to the Steam Knights adventures.
'Why', you ask?
Do I need a reason to do something for my beloved sister?
But, do you really need to read it?
Do you really need to read a book you have no interest in at all, but feel pressured by others our age to read?
I do want to read it.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Didn't you tell Father you didn't want anyone asking you why a Victorian wouldn't enjoy stories about the Steam Knights?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: This book... did Dad ask you to buy it for me?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Why do you ask?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Because... how did you know?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You're backing away from me, Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I don't want you to be scared of me like everyone else.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: No, I...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: If me knowing what you told Father is so scary, how about we dance together to calm you down? Hm?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: A... dance? Really?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Why not?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: With those words, Eblana gracefully extends a hand towards her sister.
But in Loughshinny's memories, even when her parents put on their favorite music, even when Father shook his head to the melody, even when Mother tapped her fingers to the beat...
Her sister would only sit perfectly still while bearing an icy smile.
She had never moved her body to any tune. Not even once.
Once you can keep up with me, you'll no longer have to worry about any book, request, or even friends our age.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The unopened knight novel falls to the ground, and the pleasant new book smell is now drowned by muddy water.
She was still young then. She never imagined that achieving her desires could feel so heavy and bitter. She only remembers stumbling, turning away, ignoring what was reaching out to her...
A soft and cold hand.
Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The crowd is gone. You need no longer hide your identity.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Do you still think of them as alive, even now?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I only know that every Taran's heart burns with a similar flame. And that ever since our ancestors first bent the knee to the Victorians, that flame has never gone out.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: That goes for all the townsfolk, as well as those who followed me back here. They all have the same fire, except that theirs has never been tainted by the shade of death.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: What a wonderful analogy, Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Then let me ask you again: what will you do?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Dye these flames in your own hue? I imagine you must have tried already.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: No matter who they are, once tainted by death, your flames can only render them into ash.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: So I have a proposal, Loughshinny. Kill me.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: And everyone in the city as well?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: If it bothers you how this will be recorded in history, then you can just say that I killed them, and that you merely laid them to rest.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The people of Na Saoirsí are still alive.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Even if what animates their bodies is not life, but death?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: If they were truly devoid of even the faintest spark of life, they would have long since become one of those hollow, shambling corpses you have wandering about.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Oh, they will. Eventually.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: No, they won't.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I'd rather see the purple flames in them as a plague, one instigated by you.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: And you plan to find a cure for it?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: That's right.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I want to cure you of it as well, Eblana.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: How wonderful.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: ...Wonderful?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Yes. That's absolutely wonderful.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Did you not notice?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: You aren't trying to run from me anymore. You're trying to cure me, of all things.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Come, dance with me, Loughshinny. The same dance I've always invited you to, the one you always ran from.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: What... did you say?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I asked you to dance with me.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But before the final bar, be sure to pierce my heart with your spear. This plague is lethal, and there is no cure. I do not question your resolve, but your efforts will be in vain.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: You've run from your fate long enough... From Na Saoirsí's fate, and ours too.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: It is not yet Samhain, but the boundary between life and death is more ambiguous than it has been in all of Taran history.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Do you truly wish for Tara to become a kingdom of death?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Loughshinny subconsciously turns her head away.
The fierce purple flames still rage in the skeleton the hero dragged all the way here. Culann, now taken over by purple flames, briefly stands up before sinking back down to kneel.
She cannot bear another look at him, so she turns her gaze back to her sister's eyes—and the hand she's been offered for so many years.

It is unclear if it is her imagination or a side effect of the purple flames depriving everything they touch of vitality, but the hand before her seems so pale and bloodless compared to the one in her memories.
We speak of a city and the lives of countless people, Eblana. You cannot sum this up as a matter as simple as 'fate'.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Are you finished? I believe we've spent enough time talking past each other.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: ...Eblana!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Oh, but feel free to continue. If you so desire, I shall wait here for as long as you need me to.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But do try not to take too long. You can afford to wait, yet that may not be true for others.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: (Breathes deeply) You're right. You can afford to wait, but that may not be true for others.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Alright. I'll dance your dance. Until one of us falls and can dance no more.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: But I will not follow your lead. Absolutely not.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: As you please.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Though you seem to have misunderstood something, my dear Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The one who cannot afford to wait is standing before you now.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: 'Cannot afford to wait'?
Loughshinny scrutinizes her sister's face as she suddenly realizes something entirely unrelated to their conversation.
The offered hand is indeed pale, and it is not just her imagination.

Purple flames seem to weave together into an omnipresent cloak, giving Eblana her beautiful yet terrifying appearance. Yet they also fail to conceal the malady which seems to consume her beneath her pale white skin.
She shouldn't be like this. She was never like this before.
Eblana, are you...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Are you... alright, Sister?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: A smile spreads across Eblana's face. The same old ice-cold smile is always found there.
This time, it seems to bear some warmth, but this only highlights her conspicuous paleness.
I appreciate your concern. Really, I do.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: After all those apathetic partings and painful reunions, to only now hear you asking if I'm well... It has truly been so long.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Incidentally, I really do want a dance with you.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: ...I will, once I find a way to heal you.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Very well. Then I shall await you here.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Eblana strides towards the citadel, her footsteps so faint that they seem almost frail.
Phew...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Hoo... Red dragon! Nemos!
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: There was no one at the gates when I got back! I thought something must've happened! What's going on in the square—
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Red dragon... what's that...?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Loughshinny is holding a small box in her arms. The dim night lights seem to make it harder than usual to see.
I couldn't save Culann. I...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: This was the only way for him to rest in peace. So he'd no longer have to suffer from the flames in the square.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The nomad is silent for a long time, until she finds a stone on the ground.
She hurls it with all her strength towards the citadel.
But the darkness of the night swallows it up, and it fails to even make a sound.
It's already past curfew. Nemos, Brigid, let's just—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: No...
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Nemos reaches out to the wooden box, as if trying to brush nonexistent dust off the lid.
She suddenly recalls being rejected by her own people a few days ago, and the superfluous words she heard then.
The wakemen do not stand with the living, nor do we require their reverence. Until, of course, they are dead.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: That is the tradition Dublinn should be honoring.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Still, I'm grateful you were at least willing to give me this whistle... I'll be going now.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Wait, Nemos. You knew well that Samhain approaches and the wakemen would be lacking sacred instruments. Yet you still came.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Did the Dublinners force you to?
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: No, I came here of my own—
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Nemos, you haven't changed one bit.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: You wait, mediate, and reconcile... Are you also like this in Na Saoirsí? Do you also serve the Red Dragon like this?
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: I just... don't want to see a situation that could be improved deteriorate any further. Or people who could have cooperated fighting each other.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: If conflict is inevitable, you will only ever sink deeper into the mire.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: The city has tainted you with its darkness, Nemos.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: So, The Leader—the Red Dragon—
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Eblana will never give Na Saoirsí true life? Is that right, Loughshinny?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: She said she couldn't. She... actually doesn't like to lie, unless there are other circumstances...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: She's The Leader of Tara, the one and only Red Dragon, what could possibly be tying her hands?!
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: What's wrong, Nemos? You seem... different...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I get it. I finally get it, Your Highness Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: It seems that that fire can in fact infect the living.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Nemos?!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The people I once depended on turned out to be a swarm of selfish parasites.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: The Leader I once believed in turned out to be an evil dragon who doesn't care if anyone else lives or dies.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: The people I once put my life on the line to protect... became the reason my closest friend died.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: I can't even imagine what they would have done to him if that wicked dragon hadn't lit him up with her flames.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Culann was right to ask what we would do once Samhain is over. What should I do?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Other than revenge, there's nothing left for me either.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: As she utters these words, Loughshinny sees a flame ignite within the final Na Saoirsían left untainted by the purple fire.
Your Highness, will you regard me the same as the rest of the residents—a servant of Eblana?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: No. This deadly disease... It has ultimately infected even the last person in the city.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: If so, Your Highness, then I swear to you that I will aid you in this dance that's been forced on you. Until the very end...
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Until the wicked dragon falls.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: ...I have heard your vow.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Now, I must leave the city for a while. Come with me, Nemos.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: To the wakemen?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Mhm. I have no hope of curing the flame here, so I thought we should seek aid from anyone who might be able to help.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: No, I can't go with you. I have no right to be there anymore.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: I'll stay in the city. As long as the Red Dragon doesn't realize what's going on and tear me apart... I'll try my best to keep the situation from deteriorating.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Though, I'd appreciate it if you could return this whistle for me.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: And... Culann too. Please give him a proper funeral.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: A proper funeral requires eulogies from friends and family, so... I'll write one. Could you read it for me there?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: ...Alright.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Here. It's done.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: I'll go with Reed. The Dark Woods aren't lettin' anyone in or out, but it should be smoother with us two.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: No, Brigid. You should stay too. I need your help.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Reed?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I'll be fine by myself.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: That works, but... Nemos, you're so different now.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: ...I guess this is what vengeance does to a person.
attributes.name: Nemos
